title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4024.2 - Disqualification of certain horses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4024.2 - Disqualification of certain horses

State Regulations
(a) No horse shall be allowed to enter or start if the horse was knowingly entered
under a name other than its own by a person having lawful custody or control of
the animal at the time it was so entered. (b) No horse shall be allowed to enter or
start if a person having lawful custody or control of the animal knowingly
participated in or assisted in the entry of racing of some other horse under
its name. (c) For the purposes of
subdivisions (a) and (b) of this section, the name of a horse means the name
reflected in the registration certificate or racing permit issued with respect
to the horse by The Jockey Club. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

4024.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
